DOC.HEADLINE: WORLD IN BRIEF ; HAITI ; U.S. PRESSES ARISTIDE TO NAME A PREMIER
DOC.TEXT: Concerned about a political vacuum in Haiti , the State_Department urged exiled President Jean-Bertrand Aristide to lay the groundwork for a new government by naming a prime_minister . Haiti has been without a prime_minister since the previous Aristide appointee , Robert Malval , stepped_down in mid-December . His government lasted but four months and was ineffective because of intimidation by armed groups loyal to the military .
